author: Michele Di Cosmo
comment: Just installed and evaluating. Feature request: complication showing time untill next wake up alarm

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: Thanks for your input, I added it to the list of new features.

author: Awesomedan K
comment: You have to pay for everything! -

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: No mate. Please contact us on wakeupwell@pete.ch to clarify. Thank you.

comment: The biggest problem with the stock app, and the reason I got this one, is the fact that the stock app is too easy to dismiss (you sleepily cup your hand over the watch face, the alarm is turned off, and you go back to sleep). It's not so easy to dismiss this alarm. I wake up feeling more refreshed and it doesn't wake my wife up. Great job!
I have trouble waking up even with 8 alarms set. This did the trick

author: Mike Nunn
comment: A great app. Wakes you up when hope you are ready. Get rid of your noisy alarms.

author: Andrei Arcan
comment: Easy 5 stars, works 4/5 times but that is about my body and brain, the app and the algorythm it's 10/10

author: lee bob
comment: Really useful app! Worth the money and worth been woken up earlier too. I haven't noticed any battery drain on the watch or the phone.  Had a slight problem which was actually hardware not software related and the customer service was great! Keep up the good work guys!
title: Worth every penny!

comment: It's a useful application with a simple design that is also responsive. Great job developer.
title: Useful.

author: Akshay Deshmukh
comment: Quite useful app for waking up early. Great work by developers

author: Dermot L
comment: Enjoying Marshmallow edition very much

author: Lochlan McBride
comment: Works very well!

author: Sameera Anupriya Perera
comment: Works well with my Android watch
title: Works a treat

author: Nitesh Patel
comment: Nice app.

author: Colin Cappelano
comment: I use this every night as my alarm. Other apps are bloated with unnecessary options and "useful" graphs. Wake Up Well has the right simple to use options and an easy to understand chart without being overly bloated and difficult.
title: Best smartwatch alarm!

author: Anthony Miller
comment: Loving the new interface. I use this to wake up every morning. It is way better than a jolting sound alarm.
title: Perfect

author: Aurelien Fluri
comment: I've never slept better befor. And it is very easy to use
title: Great app

author: Chris Holloway
comment: I've purchased this and it was working fine. Reset my urbane the other day, now it won't let me access the paid features. Clicking buy and it opens on my phone and says "you've already purchased thanks" but the premium features never manifest. I've uninstalled and reinstalled but still no luck.

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: Hi Chris, please contact us on wakeupwell@pete.ch to resolve your issue, thanks.

title: Was working well but...

author: Day Antonio
comment: Update: Developer reached out and walked me through fixing the glitch.  All works as expected with no issues.  Great customer service .... Purchased the Premium but features are not made available on both of my smart watches.

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: Thanks for the update, I'm happy that all works perfectly now.

title: Issues solved...👌👍👏

author: Mark Hiskey
comment: Best part about this app is the way the alarm buzzes on my Moto 360 watch. With the premium version (I recommend getting it) You can set a window around the alarm time and it gradually wakes you up in that window. Much better way to wake up vs the sudden shock of traditional alarms.
title: Great Alarm For Android Watches

comment: Just bought the premium version.  Only used one night and it seemed very well designed and intuitive (swipe one way for snooze and the other for cancel).  I had used Sleep as Android before just for the smart watch integration but it has a horrible interface and seems like way too much overkill and it sucked the battery like crazy.  My only real suggestion, have an option for a larger font current time that is shown when the alarm is going off.  It's a bit small for sleepy / blurry eyes in the morning.

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content:
Nice to hear that you like the app.
You can adjust the text size in the settings of the watch, hope that helps.
Cheers

author: Hugh Morris
comment: Used to be useful now every feature has been removed and has to be separately purchased.

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: No Hugh, we added new features for the Premium version but didn't remove existing ones. The only change to the existing features was to set the "Wake up window" to 30 minutes compared to 20 minutes before.

title: In app purchases ruin everything.

author: Thad Decker
comment: I used to use the Jawbone UP24 and one of the things I loved was the alarm clock. It monitored your sleep and woke you when you were in a light sleep versus a deep sleep; inside a certain window of time from your chosen wake up time. When I got my new Moto 360 that was something I missed most. While the stock alarm is fair - it is not good and glitches quite often. This app is the answer. It does a great job and wakes me up with no problems. The dev is quick to answer questions and I think it is well worth
title: Great app and great developer

author: Steve B
comment: It works great. I'm getting much better rest with this app and I couldn't be happier. It brings whole new functionality to Wear. Well worth the premium fee just to be able to support a great dev, the developer LISTENS. And the premium features are worth it.... Would like an option to tag/name certain alarms so I know which week I should turn it on for. Possibly in phone app since it's hard to write on Wear.

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: Thank you, we're happy you like it.

title: PHENOMENAL

author: Craig Miller
comment: After the latest update on my Moto 360 the app acts like I didn't purchase the premium version.  Ok. I uninstalled and reinstalled the app and it is working correctly again.

author: Joe Ward
comment: Great app and works really well with android wear. Software does anything you could want after the last update.
title: Amazing. Got me through many morning s!

author: Hayden O'Sullivan
comment: It's awesome and well worth the cost to get the pro version.  The only possible improvement is to allow you to set the alarms on your phone. At the moment, the alarm can only be set up on the watch.  I would prefer to set the alarms up on my phone, as it has a larger interface.

author: Thomas Krinke
comment: Tried it for a month. Needed something that would wake me up without disturbing the wife and baby. Took a few nights to get use to it, but it works great when I remember to set it. Nice work.
title: Works great

author: Mikko Käyhkö
comment: I purchased the Set window time option but then needed to reset my watch and it doesn't recognize that option anymore.  EDIT: Thanks, now working perfectly!
title: OK

author: Cac Ko
comment: ..but what about recurring alarms or multi alarms, am I missing something or it is not supported

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: The repeated alarms are now there in version 2.0. Please check them out..

title: all is good

author: Edward K.
comment: Way to find uses for new tech, devs. I would love to see a challenge function in order to snooze/turn off alarm. Phone based alarms use math or memory. Or maybe require nfc contact with the phone. I dont know. Maybe you can think. Of a way to implement it. Thanks for your hard work!
title: Excellent innovation, with an idea...

author: john hyde jr
comment: Don't really know if it works or not, because there's no way of proving it. My partner and I like the fact that it vibrates on my wrist, and not an annoying alarm clock, as she works odd hours. Only downside is, I'm used to charging my watch when I sleep, why only 4 stars. I did donate the $1.03 so they can improve it! I think it has great potential.
title: Well it wakes me up

author: Connor Rickards
comment: Pay to use.

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: Usage is free. You only pay if you want to adjust the wake up window and use repeated alarms (see description).

author: Ed I
comment: Works exactly as described with 2 minor limitations. 1) can't set repeating alarms so you have to set an alarm every day 2) because it creates a notification on the watch when the alarm is set, you a) can't set it earlier in the day because the notification is always there and b) have to first dismiss other notifications that may have appeared on top over night to snooze or dismiss the alarm. Otherwise a great alarm for android wear and I'm using it as my default alarm now.

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: Hi Edward, both your limitations are eliminated now: Version 2.0 adds repeated alarms and removes the notification as it doesn't make sense anymore. Hope you like it.

title: Almost perfect

author: Augustin Chenault
comment: If I set up an alarm for 8:00 AM with a 30 minute window, is that 30 minute window from 7:30 to 8:00? Is it 8:00 to 8:30? Is it 7:45 to 8:15? A little clarity and some more options would be appreciated.

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content:
Thanks for pointing this out, the explanation is now in the description text.
The set alarm time is the latest time you will be woken up. In your example, the window is therefore 7:30 to 8:00.

title: Not much information

author: Erminio Santiago
comment: It doesn't seem to do anything(update) got it to work, but i do wish it had more settings like days of the week (repeating alarms)

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: Nice does it work now. The repeated alarms were added in version 2.0, we hope you like it.

title: Useless

author: Giuseppe Falanga
comment: Tested and worked!!!

author: Keith Smith
comment: Exactly what I expected

author: Tony Dumbart
comment: Works really well while not affecting battery life of the watch noticeably -unless you press snooze too often. ;) Simple and clean interface. Alarm reminder in the evening makes setting of alarm effortless. Great app!
title: Gentle and silent alarm

author: Sergey Karpushin
comment: it didn't wake me up

reply.author: AppDevs
reply.content: Hi Sergey, I'm sorry to hear that. Please contact us on wakeupwell@pete.ch, many thanks.

author: Joymmar Camero
comment: Friend
title: Cabron
